form.name: aspnetForm

div.p: All AESD Schools and AESD District Offices will remain CLOSED through the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Free student meals to all children under the age of 18 from 11 - 12:30 pm daily at the following 4 locations: Adelanto Elementary, George, Morgan Kincaid, and Ted Vick. Meals will be “grab and go” using a drive through style hand off. Walk ups are welcomed too. AESD has created weekly resources for your child to maintain their academic skills during our school closure. You may access the materials by picking up a weekly paper packet at our district office lobby area from 10 - 2 pm or click on the top tab labeled "Education Opportunities on our website".

AESD Schools and District Offices CLOSED for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year

span.p: Due to California's "Stay at Home" orders, with the direction of our State and County leaders, and for the safety of our students and staff, AESD will be extending our school closures through the end of the 2019-20 school year.

With the exception of next week, April 6 - 10, our Spring Break, student meals and student learning opportunities will continue through June 3, 2020. More information on additional student distance learning opportunities will be given in the upcoming weeks.
During our Spring Break, April 6 - 10, all students under 18 can still receive FREE "grab and go" meals at the following schools within the Victor Valley Union High School District:
Hook Jr. High (15000 Hook Boulevard, Victorville)

div.a: Title 1 Parent Involvement Survey

span.p: In order to allocate state and federal funds to school sites, we need to hear from you. Please click on the corresponding link below. English Title 1 Parent Survey Spanish Title 1 Parent Survey

a.title: Click to read more about: Title 1 Parent Involvement Survey

div.a: Read More about Title 1 Parent Involvement Survey
Trustee Area Survey

span.p: AESD is transitioning from an At Large Election Process to a By-Trustee Area Election Process. The first Public Hearing on Trustee Area Scenarios will be at the Regularly Scheduled Board Meeting on August 27, 2019. We want to hear your opinions!

p.a: Visit the Trustee Area Survey page to learn more.

div.a: Superintendent Search Survey

h2.img: San Bernardino County Superintendent of Schools (SBCSS) has been selected by the Board of Trustees of the Adelanto Elementary School District to conduct a search for their next Superintendent.

span.p: An important part of the search process is to gather input from employees, parents, and community members pertaining to the qualities they would like to see the Board of Trustees consider as they look to select their next Superintendent. As an employee, a parent, or community member of the Adelanto Elementary School District, we invite you to participate in a survey by answering the 4 Focus Group Questions posed below. Each open-ended question has been written to allow you an opportunity to share your thoughts with the Board of Trustees that they may consider as they go through the selection process. Please go to www.aesd.net/survey and select Superintendent Search.

a.title: Click to read more about: Superintendent Search Survey

div.a: Read More about Superintendent Search Survey
Technology Survey

span.p:
Help us, help the students! In order to better address and assist the students of the Adelanto Elementary School District, The IT Department invites you to take a brief survey (roughly 5 minutes).
The responses of this survey are confidential and will be used to provide better educational opportunities and a better understanding of our community’s needs.

a.title: Click to read more about: Technology Survey

p.span: To prepare every student to be successful in high school, in college, in career, and in the 21st century global community.
To be the High Desert’s premier learning establishment where dreams are awakened, academic achievement soars, and integrity leads the way to future success.
